definition: A fruit that is typically red, green, or yellow.
A set of written, printed, or blank pages fastened together.
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout.
A large herbivorous mammal with a trunk.
The seed-bearing part of a plant.
A stringed musical instrument.
A building for human habitation.
Frozen water.
An area of land overgrown with dense forest and tangled vegetation.
A toy consisting of a light frame with thin material stretched over it.
A large tawny-colored cat that lives in prides.
A large natural elevation of the earth's surface.
A small book with blank or ruled pages for writing notes.
A vast body of salt water that covers almost three-quarters of the earth's surface.
An instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite or a similar substance.
The female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.
Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops.
The star around which the earth orbits.
A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk.
A device consisting of a circular canopy of cloth on a folding metal frame supported by a central rod.
A stringed musical instrument of treble pitch.
A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain.
A musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden bars of graduated length with one or more small wooden or plastic mallets.
A medium-sized sailboat equipped for cruising or racing.
An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes and an erect mane.
A heavy object used to moor a vessel to the sea bottom.
A structure carrying a road, path, or railway across a river, road, or other obstacle.
A device for recording visual images in the form of photographs or video.
A barren area of landscape with little precipitation.
A machine with moving parts that converts power into motion.
A large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth.
A piece of ground adjoining a house, used for growing flowers, vegetables, or fruits.
A tool with a heavy metal head mounted at right angles at the end of a handle.
A piece of land surrounded by water.
An outer garment extending to the waist or hips.
A room or area where food is prepared and cooked.
A structure consisting of a series of bars or steps between two upright lengths of wood, metal, or rope.
A reflective surface, typically of glass coated with a metal amalgam.
A very fine slender piece of metal with a point at one end and a hole for thread at the other.
A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind.
A large keyboard musical instrument with a wooden case.
A warm bed covering made of padding enclosed between layers of fabric.
A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river.
An implement consisting of a small, shallow oval or round bowl on a long handle.
A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs.
All existing matter and space considered as a whole; the cosmos.
A low area of land between hills or mountains, typically with a river or stream flowing through it.
An opening in the wall of a building to admit light or air.
An imaginary line about which a body rotates.
A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.
A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere.
A precious stone consisting of a clear and colorless crystalline form of pure carbon.
A large bird of prey with a massive hooked bill and long broad wings.
Cloth or other material produced by weaving or knitting fibers.
A spherical representation of the earth or the heavens.
A hard or padded protective hat.
A colored fluid or paste used for writing, drawing, or printing.
A daily record of news and events of a personal nature; a diary.
A container for boiling water, with a lid, spout, and handle.
A device for giving light, either by the use of electricity or by burning gas or oil.
A piece of iron or other material which has its component atoms so ordered that it attracts iron.
A structure or place made or chosen by a bird for laying eggs and sheltering its young.
The curved path of a celestial object around a star, planet, or moon.
A large and impressive building forming the official residence of a ruler or dignitary.
A cylindrical projectile that can be propelled to a great height or distance.
A dark area or shape produced by a body coming between rays of light and a surface.
A loud rumbling or crashing noise heard after a lightning flash.
A thing used for transporting people or goods, especially on land.
A very large marine mammal with a streamlined hairless body and horizontal tail fin.
Spun thread used for knitting, weaving, or sewing.
A device consisting of two flexible strips with interlocking metal or plastic teeth.
A brightly colored rubber sac inflated with air and used as a toy or decoration.
An instrument containing a magnetized pointer which shows the direction of magnetic north.
A percussion instrument sounded by being struck with sticks or the hands.
Application Programming Interface, a set of protocols and tools for building software applications.
An organized collection of structured information or data stored electronically in a computer system.
A computer or system that provides resources, data, services, or programs to other computers over a network.
Software that acts as a bridge between an operating system or database and applications.
A specific URL where an API can access the resources it needs to perform its function.
The process of verifying the identity of a user or system attempting to access a resource.
A request for data or information from a database using a specific command or syntax.
A hardware or software component that stores data temporarily to serve future requests faster.
The process of making a software application available for use in a production environment.
A platform providing a foundation and structure for developing software applications.
JavaScript Object Notation, a lightweight data interchange format that is easy to read and write.
Representational State Transfer, an architectural style for designing networked applications using HTTP requests.
The process of identifying and removing errors or bugs from computer software.
A step-by-step procedure or formula for solving a problem or performing a computation.
The process of converting information into a coded format to prevent unauthorized access.
The maximum rate of data transfer across a given path or network connection.
A central location where data, code, or files are stored and managed, often using version control.
A method of augmenting or altering web page behavior using custom callbacks triggered by events.
The structure or organization of a database, defining how data is arranged and related.
The time delay between a request being sent and the response being received in a network or system.
